comment.author: 37199428@N06
comment._content: Planning a wartime wedding when the bridegroom was serving in the Armed Forces was difficult. Brides often had to hurry to organise everything in time for when her fiancé could return on leave. With so many Welsh men serving in the Armed Forces, the presence of groups or regiments of soldiers at weddings was common. Here, soldiers formed a guard of honour as the bride and groom left the church grounds.

comment.author: 69121202@N06
comment._content:
I am delighted to have found this photograph because Reginald Cooke was my boss in the early 1940's at Harrison and Sons Solicitors in Welshpool.  This has brought back so many memories for me and I thank you for that.  I also remember Harry Harrison and George Harrison who were senior partners and uncles to Reginald.

Signed Gwynedd Wardale (nee Hughes)
